content.question: The linear transformation function <math alttext="L"><mi>L</mi></math> is given by <math alttext="L open parentheses vector v close parentheses equals A times vector v"><mi>L</mi><mfenced><mover><mi>v</mi><mo>→</mo></mover></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mi>A</mi><mover><mi>v</mi><mo>→</mo></mover></math>, where <math alttext="A"><mi>A</mi></math> is a <math alttext="2 by 2"><mn>2</mn><mo>×</mo><mn>2</mn></math> matrix and <math alttext="vector v"><mover><mi>v</mi><mo>→</mo></mover></math> is a column vector. Let <math alttext="A equals a 2 by 2 matrix with row 1 column 1 value negative 3, row 1 column 2 value 7, row 2 column 1 value 11, row 2 column 2 value negative 5"><mi>A</mi><mo>=</mo><mfenced close="]" open="["><mtable><mtr><mtd><mo>-</mo><mn>3</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>7</mn></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mn>11</mn></mtd><mtd><mo>-</mo><mn>5</mn></mtd></mtr></mtable></mfenced></math>. If <math alttext="a 2 by 3 matrix with row 1 column 1 value 1, row 1 column 2 value 7, row 1 column 3 value 4, row 2 column 1 value 2, row 2 column 2 value negative 6, row 2 column 3 value 9"><mfenced close="]" open="["><mtable><mtr><mtd><mn>1</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>7</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>4</mn></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mn>2</mn></mtd><mtd><mo>-</mo><mn>6</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>9</mn></mtd></mtr></mtable></mfenced></math> is a <math alttext="2 by 3"><mn>2</mn><mo>×</mo><mn>3</mn></math> matrix of input column vectors, which of the following is a corresponding matrix of output vectors?

choices.label: <math alttext="a 2 by 3 matrix with row 1 column 1 value 1, row 1 column 2 value 7, row 1 column 3 value 4, row 2 column 1 value 2, row 2 column 2 value negative 6, row 2 column 3 value 9"><mfenced close="]" open="["><mtable><mtr><mtd><mn>1</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>7</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>4</mn></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mn>2</mn></mtd><mtd><mo>-</mo><mn>6</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>9</mn></mtd></mtr></mtable></mfenced></math>

<math alttext="a 2 by 3 matrix with row 1 column 1 value 1, row 1 column 2 value 107, row 1 column 3 value negative 1, row 2 column 1 value 11, row 2 column 2 value negative 63, row 2 column 3 value 51"><mfenced close="]" open="["><mtable><mtr><mtd><mn>1</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>107</mn></mtd><mtd><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mn>11</mn></mtd><mtd><mo>-</mo><mn>63</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>51</mn></mtd></mtr></mtable></mfenced></math>

<math alttext="a 2 by 3 matrix with row 1 column 1 value 2, row 1 column 2 value negative 6, row 1 column 3 value 9, row 2 column 1 value 1, row 2 column 2 value 7, row 2 column 3 value 4"><mfenced close="]" open="["><mtable><mtr><mtd><mn>2</mn></mtd><mtd><mo>-</mo><mn>6</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>9</mn></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mn>1</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>7</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>4</mn></mtd></mtr></mtable></mfenced></math>

<math alttext="a 2 by 3 matrix with row 1 column 1 value 11, row 1 column 2 value negative 63, row 1 column 3 value 51, row 2 column 1 value 1, row 2 column 2 value 107, row 2 column 3 value negative 1"><mfenced close="]" open="["><mtable><mtr><mtd><mn>11</mn></mtd><mtd><mo>-</mo><mn>63</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>51</mn></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mn>1</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>107</mn></mtd><mtd><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn></mtd></mtr></mtable></mfenced></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="a 2 by 3 matrix with row 1 column 1 value 11, row 1 column 2 value negative 63, row 1 column 3 value 51, row 2 column 1 value 1, row 2 column 2 value 107, row 2 column 3 value negative 1"><mfenced close="]" open="["><mtable><mtr><mtd><mn>11</mn></mtd><mtd><mo>-</mo><mn>63</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>51</mn></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mn>1</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>107</mn></mtd><mtd><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn></mtd></mtr></mtable></mfenced></math>

unit.text: 4: Functions Involving Parameters, Vectors, and Matrices (Not assessed on the AP Exam)

skill.text: Skill 1.B: Express functions, equations, or expressions in analytically equivalent forms that are useful in a given mathematical or applied context.
